comment: He is a really cool guy and wants to see his students succeed. He's readily available and willing to help anyone who has questions. He has tons of experience and is very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. There is a lot of writing involved, but he does not judge too harshly. He offers great ways to improve. Definitely recommend him.

Stepakoff's Fundamentals of Writing for Film and Television course is easily the BEST course that I have taken at KSU. He is extremely passionate about the subject, and is very helpful. I took this course during a Maymester, and I was actually sad when it ended!

Very helpful and insightful. He offers great advise on breaking into the entertainment industry, especially from a writers standpoint. He's very interested in start in up a film and television program for the university, which is something many students have been wanting for years.

I hate to write a bad review about anyone.  I found him very arrogant, private schools/university, worked in Hollywood, blah, blah. Name drop, name drop.  He "played" to certain students, ignored the other ones, physically turning his back and talking only to certain ones.  I don't get this "hot" factor.  Where? When?

He's great, I liked him. VERY knowledgeable on the craft. He has a lot of experience, he's worked on a number of TV shows, he knows the business. I didn't even do the online discussions, and still got an A. There's no book, you'll just read a few scripts. No tests, just a few presentations. It's a fun class IF YOU CAN GET IN!
AWESOME!  Great instructor.  Very thorough and patient.  You can tell he loves what he does because he wants you to love it just as much.  Gotta love a teacher with passion.

Honestly, he was the worst professor at KSU I ever had. Granted, it's an easy A. It's cool he worked on Dawson's Creek, but really, once you get past being star struck, you realize, he's not very good at teaching you the craft. Take him for an easy A, but don't expect to learn much. I was really dissappointed in him. He also seemed quite arrogant.

Prof. Stepakoff is amazing. He is very enthusiastic about his subject and has a lot of successful experience in the Screen Writing field. He was co'-exec producer and writer of DawsonÂ´sCreek. His class is a lot of work  (short assignments due every week) but they are a lot of fun. If you like writing I highly recommend his course, you learn a lot!

Stepakoff is really cool. He worked on Dawson's Creek and knows SO MUCH about his subject. He's DEFINITELY willing to help and to create personal relationships with you (which is great since he knows so many people). He really teaches you to write screenplays, well. Take him!!!
